definition: to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil

sentences.english: I enjoyed a plain steamed dumpling as a very nice morning treat.
sentences.chinese: 我喫的是素包子，清晨的盛宴。

sentences.english: The one sets the engine, is a grand-banquet's host named Oota-zyunya.
sentences.chinese: 設置引擎的，是一位自稱太田順也的盛宴之主。

sentences.english: "61" the children's day is children's feast.
Fly with the Youth Olympics dreams, step into the Jinling feast.

sentences.english: Imagine preparing a five-course dinner for the most distinguished palates in the world.
sentences.chinese: 想象一下，爲世界上最豪華的味覺盛宴準備五道正菜。

sentences.english: After the feast, the bones were stored for months in treasure houses.
sentences.chinese: 盛宴結束以後，這些骨頭就會被存放在寶庫數月。

sentences.english: Cook a Polynesian feast or an ancient Roman banquet.
sentences.chinese: 做一桌波里尼西亞宴席或古羅馬盛宴。

sentences.english: And he thought the Feast of Saint Catherine would be perfect.
sentences.chinese: 並且他認爲聖凱瑟琳節的盛宴將是最好的。

sentences.english: At the banquet of life, each language is another course.
sentences.chinese: 在生活的盛宴裏，每一門語言都是一道菜。

sentences.english: After that, thousands of flowers come out for the banquet of spring season.
sentences.chinese: 接着就熱鬧起來，百花綻放，來撲赴春天的盛宴。

sentences.english: The bleakness is with strong red and green background, dispersing after a grand feast.
sentences.chinese: 這是一片大紅大綠襯托出的蒼涼，盛宴後的散席。

sentences.english: From London to Tokyo, crowds have flocked to see this musical extravaganza.
sentences.chinese: 從倫敦到東京各地，觀衆蜂擁而來觀賞這場音樂盛宴。

sentences.english: Amidst great pomp and ceremony, it handed out some 302 gold and jade medals.
sentences.chinese: 在這場盛宴裏，頒發了302枚金玉獎牌。

sentences.english: It was a feast which empowered me to continue my journey with SIFE.
sentences.chinese: 這是一場盛宴，激勵我進一步繼續我的賽扶之旅。

sentences.english: The result is, these investor were shared finally gluttonous fill a banquet.
sentences.chinese: 結果是，這些投資者最後都分享到了饕餮盛宴。

sentences.english: For after the killing will come the feasting.
sentences.chinese: 屠殺結束之後，盛宴將會立即開始。

definition: great meal fit for dragon's son (idiom); sumptuous banquet
to start sth new or original (idiom); to break a new path/to break fresh ground
to gather happily under one roof
to arrive as planned/right on schedule
